description:
UPDATE: Moved to next week (26/11/2013) due to room overload at ICAB

Hi Technical Betatechies,

It's time to open up to the world. We are now Betatech.
After the success of the 4 first editions, it was time to think outside of the box and find people from everywhere

Thanks a lot to the Betagroup, which will be a regular sponsor and letting us be kind of a part of the Beta*.

Let's get to the point and announce the program.

Topic: The Complexities of iOS Programming
Speaker: Martin De Wulf @madewulf
Duration: 30 min (talk) + 30 min (Q/A, conversation)
Room: Fenix room (Ground floor) at ICAB / Betacowork

Sponsored by: Betagroup.
Don't hesitate to forward the event to other people that might be interested.

The GitHub group has moved also https://github.com/betatech

You can still vote and propose yourself for the next talks.
https://github.com/betatech/proposals/issues

Cheers,
the organizers (Christophe, Martin, Pascal, Yannick)
name: The Complexities of iOS Programming by Martin De Wulf

description:
Hi Technical Betatechies,

Happy new year! We start 2014 with a first session about Security - the parts you should know and more importantly do to avoid the most common attacks and pitfalls on your web application.

Topic: Security for Dummies
Speaker: Stéphan Mestach
Duration: 30 min (talk) + 30 min (Q/A, conversation) 
Room: Azzar room (First floor) at ICAB / Betacowork

Sponsored by: Betagroup. 
Don't hesitate to forward the event to other people who might be interested

You can vote and propose yourself for the next talks, here:
    https://github.com/betatech/proposals/issues

Cheers, 
the organizers (Christophe, Martin, Pascal, Yannick)
name: Security for Dummies by Stéphan Mestach
